section.p: After deployment, provides a neutral branding for marketplaces. Marketplace owners can download the source files of this branding as a branding-package.zip file and use this as a basis for customizing the layout and branding of their marketplaces. This includes the colors, fonts, background images, and logos displayed to the marketplace visitors.

Once a marketplace owner or you is finished with customizing the branding of a marketplace, you are responsible for uploading the changes to the oscm-branding container. In this way the customized layout is applied.

The customized branding must be in the same structure as the branding-package.zip file. Usually, the marketplace owner or you extracted the branding-package.zip to a folder of his/your choice, adapted the files, and created a new <folder-name.zip> file containing the customized branding.
To apply changes to the marketplace layout, proceed as follows:

ol.li: Log in to the Docker host as user root.
Extract the <folder-name>.zip file to a folder on your Docker host.

Put this into the following directory on your Docker host:
/docker/config/oscm-branding/brandings/

To load the customized layout:
Log in to the administration portal.
Choose Customize layout from the Marketplace menu.
Select the marketplace and enter the URL pointing to the location in the branding container where you deployed the custom stylesheet for the given marketplace. By default, the URL is as follows:
https://<hostname.fqdn>:8443/<new-folder-name>/css/mp.csswhere <hostname.fqdn> is the name and the fully qualified domain name of the of the host used to access , and <new-folder-name> is the name of the folder containing the customized branding files.
To verify the branding, go to the respective marketplace and log in again.
